snippet: We’re not dealing anymore with your grandfather’s Israel, and they’re not dealing anymore with your grandmother’s America either.
abstract: Thomas L Friedman Op-Ed column underscores how stalled peace talks illustrate that time has changed America, Israel, and Palestinian society; warns that Secretary of State John Kerry's mission of peace represents America effort to save Israel from trends that will inevitably undermine it as a Jewish and democratic state; contends if Kerry gives up, both Israelis and Palestinians will deeply regret it.
lead_paragraph: We’re not dealing anymore with your grandfather’s Israel, and they’re not dealing anymore with your grandmother’s America either.

headline.main: Not the Same Old, Same Old
headline.print_headline: Not the Same Old, Same Old
